intro: Chrysosplenium alternifolium var. iowense, commonly known as the Iowa watermint, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and woodlands. Its aromatic leaves and showy flowers make it a valuable species for both ecological and ornamental purposes.
